It's not often that I update one of my projects to promote another project but in some rare cases and more importantly when I feel that you would benefit from the promotion, I do.
I wanted to take a moment and let you all know that my friends at Bezier Games (makers of Suburbia, Castles of Mad King Ludwig and One Night Werewolf) have ONLY 1 DAY LEFT on their Kickstarter Project for One Night Ultimate Werewolf Daybreak. One Night is one of my favorite games and often I play it with groups when I play Yardmaster Express or other fast games that get a good amount of people involved.

Hey Everybody!
I know it's been a couple weeks sine our last update so I wanted to jump on here and let you know where everything is at. I'm still here in Essen but I wanted to get you an update before I fly home this Saturday because I'm sure that 16 hours of flying and going back to the opposite day/night schedule is going to wreck me for a couple of days.

There have been a small amount of people that have been experiencing some issues with Pledge Manager and I wanted to update you all outside of the comments section where I already posted what has happened. The update in the comments section read:  
“Ok everybody. Pledge Manager was just for people that wanted to add on extras. You didn't have to use it and I will still ship you your copies as long as you've filled out the Kickstarter Survey. I will reconcile the two surveys (only if you completed Pledge Manager) and everyone will get everything that they pledged for. All that happened is Pledge Manager sent out a reminder message since it was closing and it is now closed and locked. I've been buried in messages so it's gonna take me awhile to respond to each of them. Thank you for your patience and understanding ahead of time.”

campaign.story:
Want more information?  Visit us at http://PennyPressGames.com/  We had an awesome campaign, and thank every one of our backers.
If you haven't yet, watch the episodes!
We're really excited that Penny Press is going to be a reality. We're here on Kickstarter with a very low goal because our prize money will let us print a small run of the game.  With your support, we can upgrade the components and print more games!  We'd like to bring Penny Press to lots of tabletops.  It's a pretty great game.
We're really proud of how Penny Press looks.  
Click for larger version
Penny Press uses the wonderful artwork of Mackenzie Schubert on the cover and boards.  The cards feature actual news stories and pictures from the era -- the yellow journalism era at the close of the 19th Century.  We wanted to integrate the theme strongly with the components, but our first priority was always to make the game easy to play.  
All of the stories and penny tokens are cardboard. The reporters and score chips are wood.  Penny Press will retail at $50, and we're making it available to Kickstarter backers at $40 including shipping (and goodies like the Penny Press Extra!)
The rulebook for Penny Press is available here: PDF File
We've also prepared an instructional video, voiced by our own Kate McDermott:
PLAY

In Penny Press, you run a newspaper in the turn of the century Yellow Journalism era.  Various stories from different newsbeats will be added to the board, and you'll be able to place your reporters on them.  On each turn, you'll be able to take one action with your reporters(placing or moving them onto stories) or go to press, if you think you're ready!  Going to press involves laying out the story pieces on your player board, to form the front page of your paper!  But you'll only be able to print stories that you've got a majority of reporters on,  Better front pages with desirable stories will score more points, and increase your circulation.  
SInce our goal is just $2000, we're going to focus on the cool things we can do to make Penny Press even better!
More stretch goals will be added as these are unlocked!
Press Passes included in every Kickstarter copy!
 Penny Press Extra! Is a foldout four page newspaper we're making exclusively for Kickstarter backers, and people who pre-order the game from us at Gen Con.  It will contain all the news stories from the cards in the game, plus a few stories written for backers at the $120 level.
If you would like additional copies of the Penny Press Extra!, add $7 to your pledge for each.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've run a number of Kickstarter campaigns, including two that just ran earlier this spring! Equinox is on the boat, and should be delivered to backers during this campaign, and Heat is going to press right now! It'll be premiering at Gen Con. 

There are always possibilities for snags in timing, but we work closely with the factories to establish realistic timelines for things. Our estimates have always been within a couple weeks of actual delivery, and most of our campaigns have delivered early or on-time. 

If there are delays, we communicate them to backers through updates + email, and in the worst case where we can't deliver a certain thing, we offer a refund for it. 

Art assets for Penny Press are all completed with the exception of the stretch goals that requires well, input from the backers :)

Since Penny Press won the Tabletop Deathmatch, it has enough funding to print a short run, but we'd like to do more than that. And that's why we're here!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello, everyone. We hope you're enjoying your copy of Penny Press...in fact we hope you like it so much that you think it's worthy of an award! BoardGameGeek's Golden Geek Awards are in their nomination phase, ending in the next couple days, so time is of the essence. If you'd like to vote for us, go to:
https://boardgamegeek.com/geekawards/boardgame
And select Penny Press from the list on the left. Once our lovely cover image appears in the middle of the screen, you can select the categories you think it is deserving in. The categories we're eligible in are Board Game of the Year, Artwork & Presentation, Thematic Game, and Family Game. We'd love your vote -- awards like this mean the world to games, and even nominations help out a lot! Please note that you can only cast a vote on BGG if you have an account on the site and have used it enough to have earned an avatar via Geek Gold.

Almost every international game has shipped -- there're a few of you that haven't responded to requests for additional info (phone number, etc), so check your inboxes if you don't have shipping info yet.
If you've had any problem, contact julia@asmadigames.com and we'll handle replacements, missing games, or general dissatisfaction with the May weather.
In other news: WE DID IT! Penny Press is at stores, people love it, and it's pretty awesome. We're already talking about reprints. Thanks to each and every one of you for helping make it as big as it is.

updates.update_content:
Lots of you have your games in hand! Hurray, and excitement. We're glad to hear all the positive feedback on the box, the components, and the game itself! We were pretty careful packaging everything, but if something was missing from your package let us know and we'll fix it! The framed prints will be shipping out later this week, for the $175 level.

updates.update_userinfo: Games on their way to everyone!
updates.update_content:
Seriously. I advise against it. It's bad luck.
In continuing with our tradition of RIDICULOUS NONSENSE, we encountered a couple problems during packing today. (Spoilers: it's going to be okay, don't worry). The majority of single-game orders are going out via USPS Medium Flat Rate Priority Boxes. We specifically designed the box to fit them, because it's a good deal for Midwest and West Coast shipping. So we ordered 650 of them from the USPS, they were delivered a couple weeks ago, and we thought nothing of it until tonight. As part of prep work to start packing, we apply all the shipping labels to the boxes before we create them. It's easier to do it when they're flat!

Some people have inquired about local pickup. If you're near us in Arlington, MA and don't want your game shipped, you can stop by the Asmadi Games office to get your game! If you want to do this, you need to let me know sometime today or tonight by sending an email to AsmadiGames@gmail.com.
Games will be available for pickup today after 2PM (till 8 or so), tomorrow during the afternoon (noon-4PM), or Friday from 12PM-6PM.  If you want to pick it up next week, that's fine too, it just means you'll get the game later.

The games have arrived in our warehouse, so we're going to start putting them in boxes and sending them to you, along with copies of the fancy-looking Penny Press Extra!  You will likely see shipping confirmation emails tomorrow or on Thursday if you're in the US. International orders will be shipped out over the next couple weeks, as we have to get them down to the Greater Than Games warehouses to do the EU friendly stuff.
We also have some extra copies of the KS edition -- we printed more to make sure we had enough to cover damaged cases or mishaps. They will be available (at full price) to people ordering directly from us, with the first chance to buy going to folks that signed up at GenCon or other conventions to do so. We also have some extra copies of the Extra, which we'll have at conventions and other events!

Games are still not released yet. What this means, unfortunately, is that there's no way I can get them all shipped out before I leave for NY on Friday.  We could try and do a rushed packaging tomorrow night *if* they got here tomorrow afternoon, but it could quickly become a logistics nightmare if anything at all went wrong, since I don't have a good place to store 18 pallets for a week and a half. 
What we're going to do, is have them delivered and ship them when I get back, on April 21.  I'm really sorry about this. I have never seen something take 16 days from port to warehouse, or even remotely close. The highest previous customs delay I've had was 4 days, for Fealty.

Hey all, apologies for not updating sooner -- I help run AnimeBoston every year, and that was this weekend!
The short version: games are still stuck awaiting U.S. Customs clearance. This is one of the few things I have absolutely no control over, I can't yell at anyone on behalf of you, or go speed it up myself. I am baffled as to what's going on -- I've never had clearance take more than 3 days, and we're north of two weeks at this point. I'm really hoping I get a call from them tomorrow saying the games are on the way.

In XenoShyft Onslaught players take on the role of a commander in the NorTec Corporation. You're tasked with defending your division of the NorTec base as wave after wave of horrific aliens attempt to destroy the base and end NorTec's strip mining operation.
XenoShyft Onslaugt is a base defense deck-building game for 1 to 4 players. Using a wide array of troops, weapons, armors, and technology cards, players must last 9 rounds as the alien hordes bombard the NorTec base in increasingly difficult waves. 
XenoShyft Onsluaght has many deck-building elements, but plays more like a table top version of the base-defense game genre made popular on mobile devices.
Gameplay Features
1 - 4 players - Single player compatible, fully cooperative gameplay.
Strong focus on coordination and strategic planning - to overcome the game's intense difficulty players will need to work together.
60 Minute game length
Base-Defense with deck-building elements
Incredible art - Illustrated by three amazing artists, XenoShyft features beautiful and consistent art. All of which creates one cohesive and frightening universe.
Inventive and exciting armor and weapon upgrade cards - You'll need to outfit your troops with the best equipment if you hope to survive.
XenoShyft Onslaught Game Play Mechanics Video
Leif Paulson, a development member for XenoShyft Onslaught, walks us through an introduction to the unique and intuitive mechanics featured in the game. Please note that the cards used in this video were prototypes and may change before the game's release.
Full XenoShyft Gameplay Video
Tom Vasel (of The Dice Tower), Rodney Smith (of Watch It Played!), and Steve Avery (a veteran Game Designer) sit down to run through a full game of XenoShyft: Onslaught. Will they survive? Click below to to find out!
XenoShyft Alpha Rulebook

Already well-known and respected for our ability to bring big box games to the market that feature dozens upon dozens of highly detailed miniatures, XenoShyft Onslaught represents a new direction for CoolMiniOrNot. 
With XenoShyft CoolMiniOrNot wanted to create a deck-building style game that task players with working together rather than defeating one another. This goal lead to the development of an outstandingly brutal card-based game that played more like a tower defense game then your standard deck builder. Furthermore this focus made the game not only a great cooperative experience, but also allows Xenoshyft Onslaught  to function as a single player game. 
One of the most appealing aspects of all CoolMiniOrNot games is our ability to consistently make some of the best miniatures in the board game market. However, being a card based game, XenoShyft Onslaught has no miniatures, not including the Ajax First Player token only available to Kickstarter backers. This allowed our art direction team to use their keen eye to create one of the most beautiful card games ever made. We brought on three amazingly talented artists to create all the cards for XenoShyft Onslaught.
Thanks to this, all of the art in XenoShyft Onslaught is cohesive, beautiful, and, most importantly, creates one horrifically realized science fiction universe. 
Components
Over 400 beautifully illustrated cards
1 Large fold-out poster gameboard
1 Rubber backed playmat
2 D10 dice  - for tracking base health points.
20 Cardboard wound markers
20 Cardboard ability markers
1 Specially designed Vacuum formed tray - designed to organize and hold all your cards, both with and without sleeves. 
1 Rule book.
The XenoShyft Onslaught core box is a huge value for players already familiar with the card game genre. The game contains: over 400 cards that feature the best art seen in an original I.P. game. One large fold-out poster gameboard that is a great way to learn and teach the game because it clearly displays where all cards go. A rubber-backed play mat that duplicated the center of the poster gameboard, perfect for organizing the resource pool an for players who utilize a smaller gaming space. 2 D10 dice, 20 cardboard wound markers, and 20 cardboard ability markers, for tracking base health, damage on NorTect Troops and Hive Aliens, and used or exhausted abilities. Finally, we've spent a great deal of time designing the vacuum-formed tray that players will find inside the XenoShyft Onslaught  core box. We've taken great care to make sure the tray holds all 400+ cards, with separate slots to organize the cards, so the different card types will all have their own unique space for easy storage and retrieval. Best of all, all slots are wide enough for the cards to be sleeved if the player chooses to do so.

This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all, and also give you more stretch goodies and possibly a choice of carrier options.  
We will ship your rewards at our cost to our international hubs. Depending on where in the world you are, we will either ship you from our hub in Germany (EU backers), China (Asia Pacific backers), Canada (Canadian backers), or Atlanta (USA and the rest of the world). As a rough estimate, the game will cost about $11 to ship in the USA, about $20-$25 in the EU (due to VAT), and $11 to Hong Kong all the way up to $39 for Australia, but this may increase or decrease based on the quantity of stretch goals we might unlock and your carrier choices.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 11th Kickstarter, and there are some vagaries in terms of timing when it comes to anything produced in China, such as:

Production delays 
Shipping delays 
Customs delays

We've done our best to minimize this as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all. Since we have a lot of experience delivering Kickstarter projects, we don't believe this is in the least bit likely - we've successfully delivered Zombicide, Sedition Wars, Guilds of Cadwallon, Zombicide Season 2 (first wave), Rivet Wars (first wave), we are currently shipping Kaosball, Zombicide Season 2 (second wave), and will begin shipping Relic Knights soon.

We have three ongoing projects currently: Wrath of Kings, which is entering the final part of production, Arcadia Quest, which is currently in production, and Dogs of War which is currently in production.

Please refer to our individual project pages if you'd like to check the progress there. Each project is entirely independent of each other and have completely different development teams and have no effect on the production flow or development of XenoShyft Onslaught.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Interviews about Heat from around the Internet:
Interview with Chris at PAX East with the Heat Alpha
Podcast on The Escapist with Dave
BGG News post discussing Heat
NVS Gameplays Explanation + Review of Heat
AMA on Reddit (Today! Answers at 1PM Eastern)
Thirteen Orphans reviews Heat!
Heat is a simple to teach game, with intrigue and strategy that builds up the more you play it.  You'll play through three heists, drafting cards before each, and then paying off the Heat you've gained at the end.
Here's what's inside!
And here's a video explanation of the game:
PLAY

Heat is easy to get to the table, and only takes about 20-30 minutes to play including a quick explanation.  While the mechanics are simple, the depth of the game will become apparent after a few plays when you start predicting the cards others' play, telling white lies about your own plans, and using your misdirecting intrigue to outmaneuver your fellow criminals!  Heat is fun, and you will like it.
The rules and cards for Heat are available for download for free here: http://asmadigames.com/heat/HeatRules_PnP.pdf
The rules will be laid out in booklet format for the print edition, but not until we know the precise box size we're going with, and that depends on some of the Stretch Goals below!
Note that while the Print and Play includes just the cards, and not the tokens, the real edition will contain everything you need to play!
The Designer: Dave Chalker is the designer of Heat.  You probably know him from Get Bit, which won an Origins Award and was on TableTop.  I know him because we've been going to Origins for approximately ever!  When he told me about the concept for Heat, I immediately jumped on it and got our elite art squad working on it.
The Artist: Cara Judd drew all those things for all those cards.  She is the artist for Innovation, and the most important game ever made, Win, Lose or Banana! Cara likes to scuba dive, and hopes to one day meet a squid.  They seem like pretty cool dudes.
The Composer: Jesse Ratterree, aka Beatscribe, composed the heisty music in our video, and is also working on all the music for Asmadi Games' upcoming project, Consequential.  If you're looking for someone to do music for a KS vid, you should talk to him!  
The Voice: Kate McDermott led you through the basics of Heist training, and likes to move in a diagonal fashion.  She also will be providing the voice of Caliana for Consequential.  Kate is most likely not currently stealing a muffin from your countertop...but can you be sure?
The Developer: Chris Cieslik, that's me!  I move all the numbers around and come up with ideas that make good games great.  Sometimes I make completely unplaytested games, but that is a different story.  
Our current operation is a heist.  We're going to steal a small amount of money from each of you, and in exchange we'll give you some card game.  In fact, we're so cool that if our heist is really successful, we'll make the game even better:
 If, by some insanity we exceed $40,000, we will make up stretch goals involving a penguin.  
STRETCH GOALS COMPRESSED!  We squished down the levels for all the Stretch Goals.  We hope we can reach some!
 The backer levels for Heat aren't too complex because we like running a pretty simple heist, except for two interesting twists...
The Steal: There's one available at the start of the campaign, and sometime during each day we'll quietly make another available.  First one to the page gets it!  Remember that you can adjust your backer level even after you've backed :)
The Story: We will collaborate on an excellent Heist story for you, based on some prompting from you.  We promise it will be good, and by good we mean amazing.  And by amazing we mean written by us.

updates.update_content: I posted the Penny Press update to the Heat Kickstarter, like a boss!  So you can just ignore that one entirely.

Hey guys, sorry about the lack of news on production -- I was supposed to have a printed board sample in my hands today, but it's off by a couple days.  Will post that as soon as I have it!  
Meanwhile, Matt and Robert are running Penny Press on Saturday, Nov. 8, at the annual Carnage Gaming convention in Killington, Vt. (http://www.carnagecon.com). If you’re in the area, come on by and roll the presses!

Hey guys, thanks for your patience with us on this project.  The news is that Heat is printing!  Everything's approved and all the bits are in place, and things should be packaged and at our warehouse on December 11. And then they will get to you, via our criminal network of associates that leave packages subtly near your doorstep, at the place you would expect least.  Good luck on figuring out where that is.

Hello and good day.  It has been a while since the last update, so it is time for the new update!  
We still don't have Heat.  We're close though.  All the parts are now good to go, so the art assets and box size have been finalized, and proofs are happening.  We should be on the press next week, and it typically takes 6 or so weeks from that point to me shipping out delicious copies of Heat.  When I have a firm delivery date from the factory I'll share that.

Hey all, I wish I had better news to share, but we don't have Heat available yet.  I really wanted to have the game out quick, for Gen Con + PAX, but it's unfortunately not close.  We had a rather absurd amount of bad luck with getting the red Heat cubes sourced and to our factory, in addition to rulebook issues. I was waiting to update here on KS until I had a concrete availability date, but since Gen Con is just two days away I ran out of time on that as well!  My guess is that this has all amounted to about a two month delay, so we are looking at October instead of our planned August.  I am super frustrated and disappointed, and understand if you are too.  If anyone wants a refund, I'm more than happy to provide it.

The last few days were really exciting, and we're happy to get Heat out to you this summer.
For those of you going to Gen Con in August, sign up for our events!  Or tell your friends.  We'll have Heat there, either delivering copies to backers on-site, or having already mailed them out.
Thanks to each and every one of you that backed the project, it's going to be great!

Photo courtesy of Dawni Burton Christensen
Photo courtesy of Michael Tunison
In Yardmaster, 2-4 players compete to build trains comprised of railcars of different goods and values. However, players are restricted in connecting railcars of only the same value or good type, so if you grab a railcar you can't use, it needs to wait in your sorting yard until it can legitimately hook up to your train.
Players start with three cargo cards in hand, and three railcar cards are laid out on the table. Each player has one exchange token in one of the four colors, and whoever is to the right of the start player has a Yardmaster token. On a turn, a player takes two actions, repeating an action if desired; whoever holds the Yardmaster token takes a third action on her turn, then passes this token to the right. Players can:
Draw a cargo card from the deck or (in most cases) from the top of the discard pile.
Buy a railcar by discarding 1-4 cargo cards of the same color as the railcar, with the number determined by that railcar's value.
Swap your exchange token for another one; you can discard two cargo cards matching the color of your token to represent one cargo card of the proper color when buying a railcar.
Eight cargo cards provide bonus actions during play, such as drawing extra cargo cards or paying less cargo to purchase a railcar. The player to reach 16-18 points first wins.
Yardmaster will have top notch component quality and the best part of that is we don't have to hit any stretch rewards for it to come this way! You can count on 96 high quality, linen embossed cards that will shuffle like a dream. Hey Everybody
First let me apologize for being a bit spammy here but I really need your help and I thought since you backed Yardmaster you might be interested in Backyard Builders Treehouse. You can check the project out by clicking here or on the picture below.

I hope you've had a great weekend of gaming with your family and friends. I wanted to jump on tonight and update all the International Backers and let you know that starting Monday morning (in just a few hours) your games will start going out from Essen, Germany.

Backers in outlying/rural areas may not get their package in time for Christmas.

Hey Everybody!
Well it's super early in the morning and while I have some moments of peace that don't involve being buried under boxes and packages I thought I'd let you know how everything is going.
In order to get everyone their games as fast as possible I had to ship them out to single game, single copy backers first since these were the largest groups of people. Yesterday I started with backers that had copies of both Yardmasters and last night we finished off the triple Yardmaster Express backers.

Hey Everybody! (Coming to you from San Diego)

So here's the latest in the shipping update. As I mentioned in my previous update there are severe delays at the Los Angeles / Long Beach Ports. campaign.story:
Welcome to Treachery in Beatdown City, a beat ‘em up like no other.
Updates:
Click to pre-order via PAYPAL or Amazon!
MISSED OUT? GO ABOVE TO PRE-ORDER VIA OUR HUMBLE WIDGETS!
Pre-alpha Demo for all backers $10+! - NEW! - Going offline by May 12th!
A look at level 2
The art of Treachery in Beatdown City
New playable character concept 1
Concept 2 - NEW!
Digging Deeper - Story/Characters/Symbols
part1 - Barak Orama/Mike Moneybags
part 2 - NinjaDragon Terrorists
Developer Diary - hear from the devs!
Marriage and game development!
Treachery in Beatdown City is a tactical brawler - a mix of side scrolling beat-em-up action with snappy menu based COMBO attacks releasing on PC/Mac.
So Treachery in Beatdown City is turn based? Why is that good?
Treachery in Beatdown City is a tough game to describe, but once people get their hands on it, they are hooked. The game is every much a hybrid of action based brawlers, like Double Dragon, and action RPGs, like Fallout III.
Our primary goal has always been to make a great beat-em-up with some depth to the combat, and when people play it they generally agree that we've been successful. They also have suggestions, which we have used to make the game better! 
Instead of spending time memorizing inputs, you just pick moves from a quick to use menu, and make cool combos made up of strikes, preset combo strings and grapples/throws to take on a your enemies.
Players can also use Quick Strikes which are great for breaking open objects and can also be used to fight enemies.
There are also over the top super moves that do high amounts of damage to any enemies they hit. 
The game really feels like a combination brawler & tactics game, never veering too far to one side.
 3 heroes, 3 ways to play!
 Bruce  Maxwell is the lightweight fighter mixing in dance with acrobatic strikes that have a little bit of "magic" to his moves.
By day Bruce is a wealthy stockbroker with an affinity for Asian languages and culture, but also very proud of his Jamaican roots.
 Lisa Santiago is the middleweight fighter focusing on mixed martial arts and boxing. She is currently enrolled in the police academy and has an eye for forensic science.
Brad Steele is the heavyweight fighter with high powered wrestling throws and heavy strikes that are prone to miss. Brad is a former professional wrestler, born in Texas from a Spanish-Mexican family. 
Quick swapping on an overworld map
Swap instantly!
Overworld exploration:
The map makes exploration speedy, and gives players a chance to heal up in between fights.
Switch characters with the tap of a button when moving on the overworld map! 
Choose your path through East Fulton, look for hidden items and encounter optional boss fights that teach your characters secret moves! 
Uncut gameplay videos
Sean Baptiste from Firehose Games playing the game for the 1st time, with me on for commentary, to give you a feel of what it's like to first play the game.
And here is me playing  the game with my own running commentary
The continuation of that video, featuring Brad Steele!
The Enemies
Over 26 unique enemies and growing! : Every enemy in the game has a unique look, way of walking, and attacking style.  
There are no palette swaps here!
Grunts are focused on charging into battle.
Sneaky enemies will try to cheat their way to victory.
Grapplers focus on throwing the player.
Support characters cheer on enemies to increase their stats.
Giants are strong boss types.
And don't forget
The NinjaDragon Terrorists!
New enemy type revealed at $5K!
The Story
 Treachery in Beatdown City features a story set in a near, alternate history where the US President Barak Orama is kidnapped in the city of East Fulton by Ninja Dragon Terrorists.
Fight through a rogues gallery
Biker brawl!
 Brawl with bikers along the riverside of East Fulton. Knock them off their bikes, then prepare for a REAL FIGHT to come!
BEATDOWN IN THE PARK
 Check out a look at the survival mode!
 You can listen to the Treachery in Beatdown City EP, featuring 12 songs right now!
The final soundtrack will feature more battle themes, stage themes, character themes and of course the ending music!
 Energetic Fist
 "Treachery in Beatdown City" title theme
Treachery in Beatdown City has gone from a concept back in 2009 while we were working in the AAA games industry to a full blown project in 2012. We have invested a lot of our time, money and resources into this project. 
We have created the basis for the fighting system that we keep iterating on, and about a 5th of the game content wise. 
We need your support in order to make Treachery in Beatdown City the breakthrough brawler that it needs to be.
Budget
The budget here is to cover our expenses through to March 2015 when we will have the game on sale.
The funds will go toward the living expenses of Manny and Shawn, the core dev team, while they complete the game. Shawn does all of the design and art/writing, and Manny does all of the coding. We will also be paying for more music from Inverse Phase.
That is after the 10% fees and 10% reward costs!
BACKER FORUMS 
Everyone who funds the game at the BRAWLER tier + will have access to forums to vote on how the game will turn out! We will also give you an exclusive look at some of the behind the scenes stuff that it takes to make a game of this magnitude.
DELUXE FIGHTER  ($30
Deluxe Costumes + Weapons that boost your stats!
These are just 6 of the 9 planned costumes, and 3 of the 6 planned bonus weapons. You will get to vote on the next set of each!
FINE ART FIGHTER ($50) 
Love the art for Treachery in Beatdown City, and want it all at a super high resolution? Then get the artbook! At this level it's a PDF, but you can go for the printed version as well. 
Choose from one of two designs, plus help vote for the 2nd design!
Be in the world on a poster in the background.
   Get your own custom graffiti made for you and put in the game!
Darkest Dungeon + Juggernaut Games custom graffiti
 PIXEL PORTRAIT
On top of the Pixel Portrait reward, be a completely unique boss in the game, complete with your own cutscene dialog.
Design one of the NinjaDragon Terrorists!
 FINE ART OF FIGHTING
Diana will make a one off drawing of any character from Treachery in Beatdown City in an action pose.
VAIN FIGHTER ($500) 
Diana will make a one off drawing for you, of you, in Beatdown City style!
On top of the Pixel Portrait reward, be a completely unique boss in the game, complete with your own cutscene dialog.
  Console ports, and a better game are our stretch goals! Anything on top will go towards that! We do NOT want to bloat the game out of control.
Also we will now definitely include a mode where you can play as ORAMA! 
In order to add-on to your pledge, you can go and manage your pledge and just add the amount for any extras you want to pick up. 
For an extra copy of the game, add $10 -> this is a kickstarter only discount 
To add on the PDF manual, add $5
To add on the PDF Artbook, add $20
To add the physical soundtrack CD, add $13
To add on the shirt to any tier, add $25
To add on a physical art book, add $30
 Shawn Alexander Allen (@anuchallenger) is the game designer, animator, visual artist, writer and founder of Nuchallenger. Before creating Treachery in Beatdown City Shawn worked for 4.5 years at Rockstar games where he worked on GTA IV Complete, Red Dead Redemption, LA Noire, Max Payne 3 & GTA V.
Shawn began doing in depth analysis of fighting in games years ago both for work and on his own time, and it became more and more evident that the only thing to satiate that would be to build his own unique brawler.
Shawn was also featured on the Grio 100 
 Manny A. Marcano (@cavaliergames) is the coder and co-designer on Treachery in Beatdown City, having initially built a prototype with Shawn in Gamemaker to make sure they both weren't out of their minds creating a turn based beat 'em up. 
Manny grew up playing all manner of RPGs, beating complex games at the age of 4. He takes pride in building the stats that drive Treachery in Beatdown Cities unique battles.
Previously Manny worked at Take Two/Rockstar Games on The Darkness, Bioshock & Max Payne 3. 
Diana Santiago (@deeluxdi) is a fine artist and designed Lisa, the female protagonist, and makes all of the beautiful non-digital art assets for the game. She also created those lenticular business cards that Shawn carries around, in case you've ever seen them.
She has her Masters in Fine Art and she is also a performance artist and co-creator of the web series Supertight. 
Diana works a full time job to keep the family afloat during development. 
Inverse Phase (@inversephase) is the composer for all of the music. He has had music on a number of soundtracks including the Super Meatboy OST. Inverse also ran a successful kickstarter to launch a Trent Reznor approved Nine Inch Nails cover CD called Pretty Eight Machine.
Treachery In Beatdown City Will Rearrange The Face Of Modern Brawlers - idigitaltimes
Treachery in Beatdown City, $5 and being uncomfortable for your dream - Polygon
"Treachery in Beatdown City looks like a fascinating hybrid of well-worn gameplay mechanics made fresh as a result of their fusion." - Polygon
TREACHERY IN BEATDOWN CITY RECREATES AN NYC CHILDHOOD IN 16 BITS - Killscreen
How About A 2D Brawler With a More RPG-Like Combat System? - Q & A on Kotaku comments
From Poverty to PlayStation...One Game Dev's Climb Toward Success
The Spawnpoint Blog podcast
Write What You Know, Learn What You Don't - Giantbomb
Nostalgia and Treachery in Beatdown City: A Developer Q&A with NuChallenger - Games Abyss
Huge thanks in advance!
We can only do this with your help, and we greatly appreciate all of your support. 
On behalf of the team, thank you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Game development is an in depth practice filled with technical difficulties, playtesting, bug testing, and numerous other things that can drive a project off rails and delay it substantially.

Shawn has shipped numerous projects on the AAA game level that were on time, or delayed at the last minute and out of his control. The experience with shipping video games, both large and small, is nothing new.

Shawn and Manny both have in depth QA backgrounds helping on AAA & smaller indie games.

At the same time Shawn, Diana and Manny have their own money in the project already, and have spent a lot of time on preproduction to make sure that game development can go as smoothly as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

 Dig Down Dwarf is a fast-paced press-your-luck dice game that is also the winner of the Micro Game Challenge! 128 designs were entered into the contest and Dig Down Dwarf was unanimously picked #1 overall by the judges! The Micro Game Challenge was judged by board game critic Cyrus Kirby, who is better known as Father Geek, and by the podcast team at All Us Geeks. Here is what they said...
Dig Down Dwarf is a fast and casual game that is fun for all ages and all skill levels. Newcomers will be attracted to the easy-to-learn rules and press-your-luck mechanics, while skilled gamers will love the ability to alter dice rolls by spending gems. There is a bit of something for everyone, and the quick playtime and portability make it a great travel game and an outstanding filler game as well.
Your support will allow us to produce this great game and get it into the hands of people all over the world to enjoy! Kickstarter allows us to manufacture a high quality product that we can all be proud of. As an Indie Publisher we thank you for your pledge!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our goal is to make a quality product and we understand the challenges of doing so. Our focus is to stay engaged with both our manufacturers and backers to keep everyone on the same page and informed. An informed backer is a happy backer.

If challenges arise, we will hit them head on. Sometimes an issue can cause a delay, and while delays are typically avoided, producing the the best product is always our end goal. Again, open communication with our backers is key.

All fulfillment will done in house via the use of USPS. We have our quotes from manufacturers in hand and all artwork outside of possible stretch rewards is done.

We also have experience with Kickstarter, having run 5 successful campaigns for Plague The Card Game, Zogar's Gaze, Tasnia, Neptune, and Four Tribes. We feel that this experience gives us a good advantage if and when any issues arise.

All of our previous projects have been shipped to backers with the exception of Four Tribes which is not due until September. Of the four projects we have delivered, three were on time, and only one had a minor delay. Again, we always keep an open line of communication with our backers.

My latest solo-play design just launched last night and things are rolling! Gate is a medieval horror game where you are trying to protect your stronghold from invading vile creatures from the local forest. It uses deck-building as its driving mechanic. It comes housed in a small sturdy hinged tin with full-color printing. You can literally keep it in your front pocket!
Gate is being ran as a Crowd Sale on the Game Crafter. What does that mean? Well a crowd sale is much like any other crowd-funding platform, except the Game Crafter both manufactures and fulfills all orders. In stead of forced, and often trivial, stretch goals, crowd sales instead lower the price for all backers whenever we hit certain milestones! That is right, the game actually just drops n price for everyone instead of adding stretch goals. Gate is complete and doesn't need any useless added content. Offering a money back guarantee is a frightening concept but I am SO confident in Pay Dirt that the fear of it goes away. I have played Pay Dirt with so many people and when they have doubts about the game those doubts disappear once they have the chance to play and see what a truly fun and amazing game that it is. So now it's time to put my money where my mouth is. 
If you are not happy with Pay Dirt for any reason whatsoever within 1 month of receiving it you can return it to Crash Games for a full refund of your pledge amount no questions asked. If you're out of the United States you will be able to return it to one of our local shipping partners to keep your return shipping cost at a minimum. Pledge with confidence.
Pay Dirt is an engine building, worker placement game set in frigid Alaska for 2-4 players. Players are competing to manage and grow their entire mining outfit while acquiring the most gold before the ground is too frozen to dig. The Alaskan countryside is an inhospitable environment, so players will face hardships that affect their entire outfit – not to mention the ever-dropping temperature that will shut down their operation.
In Pay Dirt, players start with a small basic crew, an unimpressive claim, mediocre equipment and just a little bit of cash to make a go in one of the toughest competitions this side of the globe. Gold mining isn’t cheap and players will have to sell their gold throughout the game to keep the equipment running and their workers happy. Through clever use of their equipment and workers, players can make their mining outfits more efficient and dialed in to their preference of play. Will you recruit heavily and stack your camp with workers or will you keep your eyes on better and more efficient equipment? Will you have what it takes to hit to strike it rich and hit Pay Dirt?

Pay Dirt is Crash' Games biggest project since we launched our first project three years ago. Pay Dirt has been in development for over two years and we are honored to be able to publish a game by Tory Niemann (the designer of Alien Frontiers)
Here at Crash Games we know that our Kickstarter Backers are the single most important aspect to being able to bring our board games to market. It has truly been an awesome and rewarding journey with Rise!, The Lost Dutchman, Dungeon Heroes, Paradise Fallen, Council of Verona and "Where Art Thou, Romeo?".
The conversations that we have had with you all at conventions, local game stores, BGG and here on Kickstarter truly inspire us to continue creating and acting as a channel to bring talented designers' and artists' work into the hobby all while helping people create lifelong memories with their friends and family. We are eternally grateful and humbled by your support and we continue to need that support for Pay Dirt; we simply cannot do this without you. Whether you are a first time backer of Crash Games or a long time supporter there simply aren't enough words to say thank you!
The first thank you has to be to Tory Niemann. I cannot thank you enough for trusting me with your game over two years ago when you had very little reason to do so. I hope that I have fulfilled my promise to do Pay Dirt justice. It is a privilege to be able to call you a friend.
My second thank you is to Naomi Robinson for saving Pay Dirt with your glorious art. You have created a rich and engaging world for Pay Dirt and without you I wouldn't be launching this project. You have no idea how thankful I am for you and your art.
A big thank you to Darrell Louder for your amazing graphic design. Pay Dirt is far from an easy project and you have been there every step of the way. I wouldn't want to do this with anyone else.
Thank you to all the play testers who have played Pay Dirt over the last two years and to all the fans who patiently waited for this game that I said was "coming soon" That time is now.
Thank you to all the reviewers who take time out of their busy lives and schedules to review games, especially without charging money for it. Your contribution is invaluable to the process and without you I know that I would have hundreds if not thousands of less backers.
Thank you to my amazing nephew, Spencer who is very involved in Crash Games. The countless hours of work you do behind the scenes really helps each game grow and with that Crash Games grows. You have really come along as a developer and a salesman. I truly relish sharing this experience with you. 
Thank you to the awesome people at Board With Life, especially Donald Shults and Chris Sabat. Your voice work really drove home the theme of Pay Dirt and I am truly honored that you wanted to help out with the video and to be able to call you friends.
Last but certainly not least thank you to my amazing and beautiful wife Jessica. Three years ago you supported this crazy dream of me being a board game publisher and your support today allows me to keep running at my dreams. You are the love of my life and my best friend.

Hey Everybody!
I hope you've had a great weekend of gaming with your family and friends. I wanted to jump on tonight and update all the International Backers and let you know that starting Monday morning (in just a few hours) your games will start going out from Essen, Germany.
I really appreciate your patience as customs in Hamburg slowed things up and then the holiday. I promise that the gameplay and the quality of what you are all receiving is well worth it! Games will be going out in the order that they were on the spreadsheet and the fulfillment company in Essen said that it will take them about 4-5 days to complete and they will be using DHL to send everything. This is for all EU and Worldwide Backers as well. Backers outside the EU might have to wait a bit longer but they're still on the way!

Hey everybody!
I hope you're having a great weekend and getting to play lots of games! I just wanted to give Canadian Backers a quick update to let you know the amazing folks at Snakes & Lattes in Toronto have sent out games to all 212 Canadian Backers and they have informed me that the vast majority of you should get the games in time for Christmas! Backers in outlying/rural areas may not get their package in time for Christmas.
This was amazingly fast and I cannot thank Ben and his team at Snakes & Lattes enough!
I hope you enjoy your games and please take lots of pics and post them on your preferred social media. People that post really awesome pics are likely to get surprises in the mail

Hey Everybody!
Well it's super early in the morning and while I have some moments of peace that don't involve being buried under boxes and packages I thought I'd let you know how everything is going.
In order to get everyone their games as fast as possible I had to ship them out to single game, single copy backers first since these were the largest groups of people. Yesterday I started with backers that had copies of both Yardmasters and last night we finished off the triple Yardmaster Express backers.

Hey Everybody! (Coming to you from San Diego)
While my family sleeps in this morning, slackers ;), I thought I would take a moment as I have good news for you regarding the arrival of our 40' Shipping Container we've been waiting on. I hope you all have been having a great Holiday Weekend for those that observe Thanksgiving. I've had a great time catching up with family and I thought it would be cool to share our epic Thanksgiving selfie.

Hey Everybody
So here's the latest in the shipping update. As I mentioned in my previous update there are severe delays at the Los Angeles / Long Beach Ports. Not only are the Dock Workers having labor disputes but the Truckers that haul the product away from the docks are also having labor disputes. This has created severe congestion as these are the busy ports in the US.

Hey Everybody!
I wanted to give you a quick update and let you know how the shipping situation is going to keep you informed but also because I know many of you pledged for extra copies to give out during the holidays to friends and family (by the way this demonstrates amazing taste in games on your part).

Hey Everybody!
I know it's been a couple weeks sine our last update so I wanted to jump on here and let you know where everything is at. I'm still here in Essen but I wanted to get you an update before I fly home this Saturday because I'm sure that 16 hours of flying and going back to the opposite day/night schedule is going to wreck me for a couple of days.

There have been a small amount of people that have been experiencing some issues with Pledge Manager and I wanted to update you all outside of the comments section where I already posted what has happened. The update in the comments section read:
“Ok everybody. Pledge Manager was just for people that wanted to add on extras. You didn't have to use it and I will still ship you your copies as long as you've filled out the Kickstarter Survey. I will reconcile the two surveys (only if you completed Pledge Manager) and everyone will get everything that they pledged for. All that happened is Pledge Manager sent out a reminder message since it was closing and it is now closed and locked. I've been buried in messages so it's gonna take me awhile to respond to each of them. Thank you for your patience and understanding ahead of time.”

Hey Everybody!
I hope everyone had an awesome weekend of games! I wanted to drop in here and share a new aspect of Crash Games with you, our new YouTube VLOG! You can keep up on all the behind the scenes stuff here at Crash Games, hear about what we've been playing as well as various industry topics. This is a new venture to keep everyone informed as well as an excellent forum for you to ask questions that I can answer. I hope o do this weekly and I'm pretty confident you'll enjoy my ramblings.

Hey Everybody.
I wanted to take a moment and talk to you all about where we stand on production and an update to the production schedule. I will always be as clear and open with my communication as I can be and never give you anything but a straight answer.
As I’m sure most of you know I have been working on bringing three games at one time into production. This is a crazy amount of work and some delays were caused that were in my control and some delays were caused that were out of my control. I will spare you the details because they aren’t really important. What is important is that you know that there were delays and I will not be able to deliver your games to you in October.

Update 1: In it to win it
It's 20XX and world stability is in danger. The US President Barak Orama travels to East Fulton to attend a summit at the UN, but is kidnapped during his speech.
A mysterious group, the Ninja Dragon Terrorist organization takes responsibility for the kidnapping, demanding $1 trillion for the safe return of the president.
The corrupt billionaire mayor of East Fulton, Mike Moneybags, won't let the police investigate unless the federal government pays the city billions of dollars in relief.
The dutiful chief of police, Antonio Santiago, calls his daughter and two friends to investigate in his stead. He needs to find out what is going on, although in the back of his mind, something about all of this just isn't right...
Welcome to Treachery in Beatdown City, a beat ‘em up game like no other. 
What makes Treachery in Beatdown City Unique?
Trailer 2!
Designed by super mega fans of brawlers: We LOVE brawlers. We grew up playing the classics: Streets of Rage, Double Dragon, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Guardian Heroes, The Punisher, Aliens Vs. Predator, etc. When setting out to create a new game in the genre we wanted to take the things we loved, and build on that. Also, we noticed when studying the greats that there are problems too, like brain dead enemies, overpowered moves, and gameplay that tends to favor dominant strategies that break the "fun".
We're here to reinvent the way you play a side scrolling beat ‘em up because we want to grow the genre!
Tactical Brawling: Use real time movement to walk around the arena, and even use some real time attacks to break open a few garbage cans or mailboxes for health or other items. When it comes to attacking, your COMBO menu becomes your best tool. 
Using a combination of Fight Points (FP) and combo meter, players of all skill types can choose up to 3 moves out of dozens of moves that will be learned over the course of the adventure to create any number of unique combinations of attacks.
Combine strikes with grapples, or do multiple grapple moves in a row. It's your choice!
Over 26 unique enemies and growing! : Enemies look different, walk differently and all have their own unique ways of attacking. The only repetition in attacks is that there are only so many ways that a person can throw a punch. Enemies range from fast and agile to slow, lumbering and extremely powerful. Some will charge you, others will play keep away.
Plus many more to come!
Enemies are broken down into class types.
Grunts have regular attacks, but also usually have 1 or 2 hidden super strong attacks.
Sneaky enemies focus on lowering offensive options for players.
Grapplers focus on throwing the player.
Support characters taunt and cheer in the fight to cast buffs on your foes and give them an advantage. 
Giants have super strong offense, but are often on the slower side.
These class types make fighting mixed groups of enemies a real challenge. And enemies can take on sub classes, so there can be a Giant Support with enormous amounts of HP and high evade or a grappler grunt who has strong strikes as well as strong grapples!
The possibilities are endless!
Learn a large array of new moves as the game goes on! – Moves aren’t in just for the sake of adding moves, as every attack, defensive maneuver and combo is tested and included only if it adds to the fighting mechanics in a positive way.
Experimentation & creativity are key elements to the experience whereas execution is not.
In Progress Over world map
Top down overworld exploration gameplay: Choose your paths through East Fulton, looking for hidden items to heal or power up your player and encounter hidden boss fights that teach your fighters even more moves! 
Plus, heal your player, seek out shortcuts through densely populated areas and find files on every enemy in the game. Read those to find out enemy weaknesses and their personal stories. 
Super special attacks! : It wouldn’t be a beat ‘em up without a super bar that fills up and allows players to turn the tide in battle. Some of these moves can even be chained from regular attacks!
A dark humor story played out in classic frame by frame cutscenes : Engage with enemies, find out the personalities behind the heroes and enemies and perhaps gain empathy for them… before having to lay a beatdown on them.
Teaser trailer from 2013, featuring a brief story introduction.
Switch characters strategically!: Each of the player characters has his or her strengths and weaknesses against every enemy in the game. Switching can be done on the overworld with the press of a button, and strategic use of each characters strengths can make a fight that would usually be very difficult much easier. 
Damage taken in between fights is cumulative, so make sure to switch, or heal your character before their next fight!

The cast
Electric Spin Kick
Bruce Maxwell is a wealthy stockbroker with an affinity for Asian languages and culture, without forgetting his Jamaican roots. Bruce is the lightweight character, fighting with a mix of Jeet Kune Do and Capoeira filled with lighting fast punches and acrobatic kicks.
Burning Lariat
Brad "The Bull Killer" Steele is a former professional wrestler, born in Texas from a Spanish-Mexican family. Brad runs a community center in the SoNo section of East Fulton to help people in need. Brad is the heavyweight character fighting with high powered wrestling throws and heavy strikes. 
Icy Spin Lobs
Lisa Santiago is enrolled in the police academy and has an eye for forensic science. She focuses on boxing and mma, with a mix of holds and brutal kicks/punches.
Click here for a more in depth look at the backgrounds of the cast.
 These are just a few tracks from the very beginning of the game, all made by the amazing INVERSEPHASE!
We started this project conceptually as a way to create something new and inventive while working other jobs in the AAA games industry back in 2009. Since then the amount of effort put in has grown significantly when we figured out that this was something people actually would want to play, and 2013 was the first full year that we were able to work on Treachery in Beatdown City in full time mode.
We spent most of that year building the core fighting system, but any good fighting system is built with tweaks to balance, as well as additions to the system. We have also gathered a lot of playtesting feedback from a large amount of people from a number of shows like PAX, Indiecade, GDC, E3 and the world’s largest international fighting game tournament, EVO. 
Our current progress is that we are almost done with the first level which takes a few hours to beat (longer than most full length brawlers!). The level features numerous songs, over 26 completely unique enemies and dozens of player attacks. We plan to add 5 more levels that will add at least another 20 enemies, a couple of dozen more attacks as well as more exotic locations and music to go along with them that we can't quite reveal yet.
Beyond adding content we will also be porting the game to Unity out of the Playstation Mobile framework and that, while similar, is a very different environment that will no doubt speed up our development, but will require moving over and changing the code as necessary.
Treachery in Beatdown City is all about creating a tactical brawler with fighting game elements, so of course we need the community to give us feedback on how best to tweak for balance. Every single backer will be able to play the game early, while those who want to get in extra early can pledge to gain even earlier access to in production levels to help us build the best fights possible.
The only way we’ll be able to launch in early 2015 is with your help. 
Budget breakdown
We have already invested quite a lot of our own funds into this game, and have already paid for some of the events/talks that we will be attending this year to support Treachery in Beatdown City - the next one being GDC in March. 
Besides that, Manny and I are working on the game full time, and need support to cover bare minimum living expenses for the next year.

campaign.story:
"Why make a movie about traffic?"
Good question.  After all, sitting in traffic probably lives somewhere in the neighborhood of root canal and taxes on our list of least favorite things to do.
But here's the thing: you don't know what you think you know about traffic. 
We tend to think of a traffic jam as something that just happens for no reason, something that just has to be endured.  That's what I thought one day when I was stuck in horrible traffic trying to get home to Brooklyn from Connecticut.  But then I started to wonder: what really causes traffic and can cities do anything about it?
The answer, many experts will tell you, is that the traffic problems that plague many of our cities are the result of deliberate policy decisions made over the course of more than half a century.
Most importantly, we changed the definition of a street--from a place where people gathered to meet and conduct business, to a means to get a car from one place to another.  That change paved the way (sometimes literally) for the car's dominance over most of the 20th century.
Now, though, a group of advocates and urban designers is trying to change that. They're working to reclaim streets as places for people rather than just pathways for cars.
"In Transit" tells their story.
"So this isn't a documentary about traffic.  It's a documentary about people."
Right.  Because changing the way streets are designed and used isn't easy.
I've filmed planners in Detroit who must convince a skeptical community that the Motor City's comeback could begin with more pedestrian and bike friendly streets. 
In New York, I've investigated why bike lanes and bike share are sometimes seen as benefits for hipster elites even though the cost of traveling by bike is far less than traveling by car.
And with this Kickstarter campaign, I hope to raise funds to continue to find more of the people and the stories that are changing cities all over the country.
"So how does Kickstarter work?"
Kickstarter is a crowd-funding platform that allows backers to support independent creative projects.  In addition to helping tell an important story about how cities are changing, your donation entitles you to some of the rewards listed at right.  Everybody wins!
Kickstarter is an all-or-nothing platform, which means we need to meet our $25,000 goal or no money changes hands.  But with your support, I'm confident we can make that money change hands!  Just click on the "Back This Project" button and complete the Amazon checkout process.
And remember, while we can't raise less than our goal, we can--and would love to--raise more.  The more money we raise, the more filming we can do
So please share our project on Facebook, Twitter, e-mail, and carrier pigeon.
The "In Transit" sticker and bike bell
"What will you use the money for?"
Streets are changing all over the country (and the world), but so far "In Transit" has filmed in only two cities.  With these funds, I'll be able to seek out and capture stories in a variety of locations that truly tell the story of America's streets.
Thanks for joining me on the journey.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Probably the biggest question any independent filmmaker faces is: "Can you really finish your film?" To paraphrase Shakespeare, the course of documentary production never did run smooth, and if you're backing a project, you want to know that the creators can deliver even when they face challenges.

Fortunately, I'm an experienced documentary film producer. Check out my bio at the upper right for full details, and you'll see that I've successfully produced and distributed an independent documentary, worked as an editor for other widely seen productions, and produced videos for large companies and non-profit organizations.

"In Transit" is at an early stage of production (which is why most of the rewards have an estimated delivery date of late 2015). There are going to be challenges along the way. But solving challenges and completing successful productions is what I do.

And with your help, I know I can do the same with "In Transit." Rest assured, I'll keep you up to date along the way. And at the end, I hope to have created a film of which we can all be proud.

------------------------------------------------------------
Watch our Kickstarter video In Full 1080p HD!
From the creators of The 1UP Show, CO-OP, I Am Street Fighter, and GROUNDED: Making The Last of Us.
NEW OUTERLANDS DOUBLE-ECLIPSE POSTER! (2/7/14)!
We're very, very happy to introduce a new poster option designed by FEZ creator Phil Fish! It'll be a high-quality print on a delicately textured surface with glossy, smooth-finished text. There's a new tier over to the right at the same cost as the existing poster tier. We won't have the other poster design until after the Kickstarter campaign is over, but don't worry! We'll be sending out a backer's poll after both designs have gone out and you can choose then which design you'd like.
NEW OUTERLANDS SHORT (1/29/14)!
Here's a taste of what Outerlands will be like. We'll have another short ready for you before the Kickstarter campaign is over. Thank you for your support!
FIVE NEW DIGITAL TIERS (2/5/14)!
Our fantastic music collaborators Jim Guthrie and Disasterpeace have offered up some INCREDIBLE music bundles for our backers! We've got new options at $45, $50, $70, $100, and $135. You can get entire bundles of music at each of those tiers, but the $70 tier is an extremely limited (10 ONLY) offering where Jim will personally sign and send you a vinyl of Sword & Sworcery LP - The Ballad of the Space Babies. If you haven't heard the S&S music or seen the artwork before, they're both incredbly impressive!
WHAT IS OUTERLANDS?
A DOCUMENTARY "TV SERIES" ... Even though this isn't for a TV network, we're calling it a "TV series" because of the format. It'll be a minimum of six one-hour episodes. A TV "one hour" can mean anything from 42 to 60 minutes.
IN SIX EPISODES ... We could potentially do more than six if we reach some of our stretch goals!
ABOUT THE PEOPLE AND CULTURE OF VIDEOGAMES ... Videogames are art. Art is culture. Within any culture are beautiful traditions, heartfelt passions, and incredible, unbelievable stories to be told. That's where Outerlands comes in.
THAT CAN'T BE MADE ANY OTHER WAY. Traditional media outlets, broadcast networks, and even the new wave of original content from online distribution aren't going to take a "risk" on videogame content. We don't think it is a risk. We think videogames are a global cultural revolution that's sweeping in whole new ways of looking at the world, inspiring countless people into new lives, and that untold numbers are aching for this kind of content. Help us prove it!
WHY $210,000?
Video is expensive—especially documentary content that requires ongoing access over a long period and a lot of travel. AREA 5 has become very good at knowing how much a production is going to cost. Originally, we were thinking about showing a bunch of awful spreadsheets and writing walls of text to explain where the money is going. Fortunately, Braid artist David Hellman came to our rescue!
WHO'S MAKING IT?
AREA 5 is Ryan O'Donnell, Matt Chandronait, Jason Bertrand, Cesar Quintero, and Rick Curnutte. You can find out more about us on the AREA 5 web site. We're also collaborating with some INCREDIBLE people that are just as excited as we are to make this happen! And, if we hit our FREELANCERS STRETCH GOAL, there will be even more people added to the team!
IS IT ONLY ABOUT PRESERVING OLD GAMES? (ANSWER: NO!)
Game preservation is only one important topic—one which is particularly easy to tackle in the San Francisco Bay Area (where AREA 5 is located), which is why it's the featured example in our Kickstarter video. Our ambition is to explore every story that we can possibly afford to! To give you a better idea of what we're going for, this series is directly inspired by This American Life, Radiolab, Objectified and Helvetica, A Life Well Wasted, 99% Invisible, Polygon's Human Angle, State of Play, and, of course Indie Game: The Movie.
WHAT OTHER TOPICS WILL THE SERIES COVER?
It goes by pretty fast in the Kickstarter video, but there's a scene with a cloud of words in there. Those topics are just a taste of what's on our list. We can't even imagine the kinds of stories other minds can bring into the fold if we can get to our FREELANCERS STRETCH GOAL!  We will also be holding polls and surveys throughout the Kickstarter period to hear about topics YOU want to cover! 
A small sampling of topics we think will result in incredible stories
WILL YOU DELIVER THE EPISODES AS YOU FINISH THEM?
No. We know from experience that we'll get the absolute highest quality by shooting and editing everything together. Whether you're backing at a level that gets you the series digitally or on Blu-ray, you'll get the entire season as a package. Filming a documentary is about being there and we want to have the opportunity to film that last great story for episode 1 even if we're just finishing shooting for episode 6. Besides, who doesn't like to binge-watch TV these days?
WHEN WILL IT BE DONE?
We are predicting 18 months from the finish of the Kickstarter campaign. That is roughly mid-July of 2015. The first six months will be pre-production (research, scheduling, travel arrangements, legal, insurance) and production (the actual shooting). Post-production (the period where we do all the editing, add in graphics, mix the sound, produce and edit a soundtrack, and so forth) will happen afterward. Kickstarter rewards will be designed and updates posted throughout the 18-month cycle.
REWARDS
We are honored to be working with Humble Bundle and Fangamer for our backer rewards! They helped Double Fine Productions and Mighty No.9 on their Kickstarters, so you know we're working with the right folks to make sure you get your rewards on time and at the highest quality!
BACKERS-ONLY LIVESTREAM - We will hold live streams at a secret URL that only Kickstarter backers will get access to. In it we'll show you stuff we've shot, rough edits of stories we're working on, and get your feedback on where to go next! We'll also trot out deleted scenes from past AREA 5 content. Watch purely for entertainment, or get more involved and help us shape the series! OUTERLANDERS UNITE!
SOUNDTRACK (DIGITAL DOWNLOAD) - All the music used in the series! At the minimum this will include licensed tracks and original tracks from our collaborators, music created by AREA 5, and other original tunes. Help us hit our 100% ORIGINAL SOUNDTRACK STRETCH GOAL, and we'll have the funding to commission ALL original music for the series!
OUTERLANDS SEASON ONE (DIGITAL DOWNLOAD) - All finished episodes of the series in a handy download.
OUTERLANDS SEASON ONE SPECIAL EDITION (DIGITAL DOWNLOAD)- All finished episodes of the series in a handy download, plus extra content like full interviews, stories that didn't make the cut for the main series, behind-the-scenes, and anything else we can think of that is interesting or awesome! We even have ideas for setting unused footage to music and presenting just for artistic value.
POSTER (DIGITAL DOWNLOAD) - A high-resolution PDF that you can print out at your leisure and use for your own purposes.
STICKERS - Quality stickers featuring carefully designed artwork inspired by the subjects featured in the Outlerlands episodes.
POSTER - Designed by one of our fabulous collaborators, this Kickstarter-only Outerlands poster will never be printed again!
T-SHIRT - Designed by one of our fabulous collaborators, this Kickstarter-only Outerlands t-shirt will never be printed again!
LIMITED EDITION T-SHIRT - A limited-run, ultra-high-quality design on the very best, super soft T-Shirts! NUMBERED! Show your support by backing early!
LIMITED EDITION POSTERS - Extremely high-quality prints designed by Cory Schmitz on equally high-quality stock!
SPECIAL EDITION BLU-RAY - There is no "Regular Edition" Blu-ray. Contains everything in the digital Special Edition plus a surprise or two! We feel it's silly to offer the Special Edition digital reward and have a Regular Edition Blu-ray at a higher cost. Yet another Cory Schmitz original, this will be a work of art designed for shelf display!
THE AREA 5 FILM FESTIVAL! - A one-day event where we rent out a theater, showcase AREA 5 films and other random, never-before-seen content (quite frankly, stuff we CAN'T show anywhere else), as well as a curated list of other videogame-themed films and shows. There will be food, drinks, and presentations from creators, cast, and documentary subjects in between the showings. VIP access means reserved seating and any other discounts or free stuff we can line up for the day of the event—stuff we can't line up until funding is complete and the event is definitely on.
STRETCH GOALS
WHO'S IN THE KICKSTARTER VIDEO?
This is where we get to thank the amazing people who have thus far lent us so much of their time and are such huge believers in this project! To Jim Guthrie and Disasterpeace for the music, and for our first documentary subjects!
If you're ever even somewhat close to Alameda, California, do yourself a favor and head out to High Scores Arcade Interactive Museum. All games are on free play and it's only $5 for an hour or $10 for a whole freakin' day! The owners, Meg and Shawn, are the coolest people ever! Also in the video are Mike Mika and Frank Cifaldi from Other Ocean Interactive. Besides being great game developers, Mike and Frank have made enormous efforts to preserve games and gaming culture. That shot of Frank looking at old slides is in Mike's famous basement that many of us first learned about on Robert Ashley's incredible podcast A Life Well Wasted. Our filming with Frank, Meg, Shawn, and Mike is far from complete, but we're already well into our production thanks to their tremendous help! We've also shot at the Oakland M.A.D.E. museum—though it isn't featured explicitly in the Kickstarter video.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our production schedule is set for roughly 18 months. That's a long time and a lot can happen in that period, but AREA 5 has been in business for 5 years and in that time we've finished dozens of productions. From full-length documentaries, to trailers, mini-docs, and fictional shorts. We know exactly what it'll take to protect ourselves and our content while making this series.

The main risks for any film project are accidents—both to equipment and personnel. Of course we mitigate this as much as possible by taking out insurance as appropriate to every production, but that doesn't mean that catastrophic events can't occur that could cause us to lose some or all of our footage on a given trip to a foreign land. If this happens and our budget doesn't allow us a reshoot, we'll find other amazing stories to tell that will allow us to fulfill our promise to deliver the series on time.

Other than losing content on location, we have a triple, multi-location backup plan for all our content. Short of San Francisco falling into the ocean, we should be covered.

Finally—and this one's a doozy—we've heard tales of certain Kickstarters that have been funded and then had their largest backers deny/reverse the charges after the campaign is over. As you can imagine, this can be hugely devastating to a lean-and-mean documentary project. There's only so much contingency a budget can absorb before something has to slip. The worst we can imagine in this scenario is having to cut an episode.
